news_header: Americans are voting for their next president on November 5, with tight races expected and potential delays in results.
news_text: On November 5, Americans will vote in a closely contested presidential election between Democrat Kamala Harris and Republican Donald Trump. Polls indicate a tight race, with potential delays in results due to changes in voting procedures and recounts in closely contested states. The election could see a winner declared on election night or take days or weeks, similar to past elections. The process of counting votes varies by state, with rigorous verification and potential legal challenges expected. The new president will be inaugurated on January 20, 2025.
